Influential members of the House Ways and Means Committee introduced legislation that would restrict how the new savings-and-loan bailout agency can raise capital , creating another potential obstacle to the government 's sale of sick thrifts . The bill , whose backers include Chairman Dan Rostenkowski -LRB- D. , Ill. -RRB- , would prevent the Resolution Trust Corp. from raising temporary working capital by having an RTC-owned bank or thrift issue debt that would n't be counted on the federal budget . The complex financing plan in the S&L bailout law includes raising $ 30 billion from debt issued by the newly created RTC .	DT JJ NN NN IN DT NN NN NN VBZ VBG $ CD CD IN NN VBN IN DT RB VBN NNP .
This financing system was created in the new law in order to keep the bailout spending from swelling the budget deficit .	DT NN NN VBD VBN IN DT JJ NN IN NN TO VB DT NN NN IN VBG DT NN NN .
Another $ 20 billion would be raised through Treasury bonds , which pay lower interest rates .	DT $ CD CD MD VB VBN IN NNP NNS , WDT VBP JJR NN NNS .
But the RTC also requires `` working '' capital to maintain the bad assets of thrifts that are sold , until the assets can be sold separately .	CC DT NNP RB VBZ `` NN '' NN TO VB DT JJ NNS IN NNS WDT VBP VBN , IN DT NNS MD VB VBN RB .
That debt would be paid off as the assets are sold , leaving the total spending for the bailout at $ 50 billion , or $ 166 billion including interest over 10 years .	DT NN MD VB VBN RP IN DT NNS VBP VBN , VBG DT JJ NN IN DT NN IN $ CD CD , CC $ CD CD VBG NN IN CD NNS .
`` It 's a problem that clearly has to be resolved , '' said David Cooke , executive director of the RTC .	`` PRP VBZ DT NN WDT RB VBZ TO VB VBN , '' VBD NNP NNP , JJ NN IN DT NNP .

The complicated language in the huge new law has muddied the fight .	DT VBN NN IN DT JJ JJ NN VBZ VBN DT NN .

The House Aviation Subcommittee approved a bill that would give the transportation secretary authority to review and approve leveraged buy-outs of major U.S. airlines .	DT NNP NNP NNP VBD DT NN WDT MD VB DT NN NN NN TO VB CC VB VBN NNS IN JJ NNP NNS .
The collapsed plan to acquire UAL Corp. , parent of United Airlines , spurred quick action on the legislation , introduced Wednesday and approved by the subcommittee on a voice vote yesterday .	DT VBN NN TO VB NNP NNP , NN IN NNP NNP , VBD JJ NN IN DT NN , VBD NNP CC VBD IN DT NN IN DT NN NN NN .
The bill is expected to be taken up by the Public Works and Transportation Committee tomorrow , and a floor vote by next week will be urged .	DT NN VBZ VBN TO VB VBN RP IN DT NNP NNP CC NNP NNP NN , CC DT NN NN IN JJ NN MD VB VBN .
The measure drew criticism from the Bush administration and a parting shot from financier Donald Trump , who yesterday withdrew his takeover bid for AMR Corp. , the parent of American Airlines . The bill is aimed at addressing the concern that an airline might sacrifice costly safety measures to pay off the debt incurred in a leveraged buy-out .	DT NN VBZ VBN IN VBG DT NN IN DT NN MD VB JJ NN NNS TO VB RP DT NN VBN IN DT VBN NN .
Currently , the transportation secretary does n't have clearly established authority to block mergers , but can take the drastic step of revoking the operating certificate of any carrier the official considers unfit .	RB , DT NN NN VBZ RB VB RB VBN NN TO NN NNS , CC MD VB DT JJ NN IN VBG DT NN NN IN DT NN DT NN VBZ JJ .
Supporters of the legislation view the bill as an effort to add stability and certainty to the airline-acquisition process , and to preserve the safety and fitness of the industry .	NNS IN DT NN VBP DT NN IN DT NN TO VB NN CC NN TO DT JJ NN , CC TO VB DT NN CC NN IN DT NN .
In general , the bill would give the Transportation Department a 30-day review period before 15 % or more of the voting stock of a major U.S. air carrier could be acquired .	IN JJ , DT NN MD VB DT NNP NNP DT JJ NN NN IN CD NN CC JJR IN DT NN NN IN DT JJ NNP NN NN MD VB VBN .
It also would require the acquiring party to notify the transportation secretary and to provide all information relevant to determining the intent of the acquisition .	PRP RB MD VB DT VBG NN TO VB DT NN NN CC TO VB DT NN JJ TO VBG DT NN IN DT NN .
The bill would allow the secretary to reject a buy-out if sufficient information has n't been provided , or if the buy-out is likely to weaken the carrier financially , result in a substantial reduction in size of the airline through disposal of assets , or give control to a foreign interest . FRANKFURT :	NNP :
One of the sharpest declines came in the financial center of Europe 's strongest economy .	CD IN DT JJS NNS VBD IN DT JJ NN IN NNP POS JJS NN .

The index closed at 1385.72 , down 203.56 points .	DT NN VBD IN CD , RB CD NNS .

Investors may have reacted so strongly to Friday 's U.S. stock market loss because they had vivid memories of the Frankfurt exchange 's losing 35 % of its value in the 1987 crash and its wake . U.S. Trade Representative Carla Hills said the first dispute-settlement panel set up under the U.S.-Canadian `` free trade '' agreement has ruled that Canada 's restrictions on exports of Pacific salmon and herring violate the accord .	NNP NNP NNP NNP NNP VBD DT JJ JJ NN VBD RP IN DT JJ `` JJ NN '' NN VBZ VBN IN NNP POS NNS IN NNS IN NNP NN CC NN VBP DT NN .
Mrs. Hills said the U.S. and Canada have until Nov. 13 to resolve the dispute .	NNP NNP VBD DT NNP CC NNP VBP IN NNP CD TO VB DT NN .
If a solution is n't reached by then , she said , the U.S. would have the right to suspend some trade concessions to Canada equivalent in value to the losses suffered by U.S. fish-processing companies in Alaska and the Pacific Northwest .	IN DT NN VBZ RB VBN IN RB , PRP VBD , DT NNP MD VB DT NN TO VB DT NN NNS TO NNP NN IN NN TO DT NNS VBN IN NNP JJ NNS IN NNP CC DT NNP NNP .
However , in Ottawa , Canadian Trade Minister John Crosbie said the dispute-settlement panel accepted the `` legitimacy of Canada 's position on the use of these landing requirements to conserve and manage these important fisheries . ''	RB , IN NNP , NNP NNP NNP NNP NNP VBD DT JJ NN VBD DT `` NN IN NNP POS NN IN DT NN IN DT NN NNS TO VB CC VB DT JJ NNS . ''

''	VBN IN DT JJ NN IN DT NNP CC JJ NN NNS IN DT NN POS NN , DT NN IN NNP NNP VBD DT NN VBD RB VBN IN DT JJ NN NNS `` VBP JJ . ''
The U.S. trade representative declined to put a dollar estimate on the losses resulting from the Canadian export restrictions .	DT NNP NN NN VBD TO VB DT NN NN IN DT NNS VBG IN DT JJ NN NNS .
Canada initially had an export prohibition that was replaced by regulations requiring that such fish had to be brought ashore in British Columbia by commercial fishermen prior to export .	NNP RB VBD DT NN NN WDT VBD VBN IN NNS VBG DT JJ NN VBD TO VB VBN RB IN NNP NNP IN JJ NNS RB TO VB .
This action was defended by the Canadian government on conservation grounds .	DT NN VBD VBN IN DT JJ NN IN NN NNS .
Mrs. Hills said yesterday that the dispute-settlement panel rejected this Canadian government argument .	NNP NNP VBD NN IN DT JJ NN VBD DT JJ NN NN .

What happened Friday shows that financial markets are not yet sufficiently coordinated to handle another meltdown in prices .	WP VBD NNP VBZ IN JJ NNS VBP RB RB RB VBN TO VB DT NN IN NNS .
No fiddling with systems and procedures will ever prevent markets from suffering a panic wave of selling .	DT NN IN NNS CC NNS MD RB VB NNS IN VBG DT NN NN IN NN .
But markets can operate with greater or lesser efficiency .	CC NNS MD VB IN JJR CC JJR NN .
After the 1987 plunge , markets agreed that it would be wise to halt trading whenever panic conditions arose .	IN DT CD NN , NNS VBD IN PRP MD VB JJ TO VB NN WRB NN NNS VBD .
The New York Stock Exchange adopted two specific circuit breakers : If the Dow Jones index falls 250 points in a day , the exchange will halt trading for one hour ; if the decline hits 400 points , the exchange will close for an additional two hours .	DT NNP NNP NNP NNP VBD CD JJ NN NNS : IN DT NNP NNP NN VBZ CD NNS IN DT NN , DT NN MD NN VBG IN CD NN : IN DT NN VBZ CD NNS , DT NN MD VB IN DT JJ CD NNS .
The rationale is that an interruption of trading will allow investors to reconsider their strategies , calm sellers and lead buyers to enter the market at indicated new price levels .	DT NN VBZ IN DT NN IN NN MD VB NNS TO VB PRP$ NNS , VB NNS CC VB NNS TO VB DT NN IN VBN JJ NN NNS .
It is impossible to know whether that theory is realistic .	PRP VBZ JJ TO VB IN DT NN VBZ JJ .
A temporary cessation of trading may indeed discourage a selling panic from feeding on itself .	DT JJ NN IN NN MD RB VB DT NN NN IN VBG IN PRP .
But there is also the possibility that shutting down markets will intensify fears and cause an even more abrupt slide in prices .	CC EX VBZ RB DT NN IN VBG RP NNS MD VB NNS CC VB DT RB RBR JJ NN IN NNS .
What happened Friday was the worst of all worlds .	WP VBD NNP VBD DT JJS IN DT NNS .
The futures exchanges followed their own pre-set circuit breakers and shut down at about 3 p.m. for 30 minutes , after the Standard & Poor 's 500 stock index had fallen 12 points , or about 100 points on the Dow Jones index .	DT NNS NNS VBD PRP$ JJ JJ NN NNS CC VBD RP IN RB CD NN IN CD NNS , IN DT NNP CC NNP POS CD NN NN VBD VBN CD NNS , CC RB CD NNS IN DT NNP NNP NN .
Options markets stopped trading in many securities .	NNS NNS VBD NN IN JJ NNS .
The New York Stock Exchange , under its own rules , remained open .	DT NNP NNP NNP NNP , IN PRP$ JJ NNS , VBD JJ .
With nowhere else to go , sellers , and particularly program traders , focused all their selling on the New York Stock Exchange .	IN RB RB TO VB , NNS , CC RB NN NNS , VBD DT PRP$ NN IN DT NNP NNP NNP NNP .
As liquidity on that market weakened , prices fell sharply .	IN NN IN DT NN VBD , NNS VBD RB .
Had the futures and options markets been open , additional liquidity would have been provided and the decline , most probably , would have been less intense .	VBD DT NNS CC NNS NNS VBN JJ , JJ NN MD VB VBN VBN CC DT NN , RBS RB , MD VB VBN RBR JJ .
At 3:30 , after intense telephone negotiations between the trading markets and Washington , the futures exchanges reopened .	IN CD , IN JJ NN NNS IN DT NN NNS CC NNP , DT NNS NNS VBD .
Futures trading , however , was halted altogether at 3:45 , after the futures markets had dropped an additional 30 points , which is the daily limit for price declines .	NNS NN , RB , VBD VBN RB IN CD , IN DT NNS NNS VBD VBN DT JJ CD NNS , WDT VBZ DT JJ NN IN NN NNS .
At this point , the options markets also shut down and once more left all sales to be handled by the New York Stock Exchange .	IN DT NN , DT NNS NNS RB VBD RP CC RB RBR VBD DT NNS TO VB VBN IN DT NNP NNP NNP NNP .
It is time to recognize that the New York Stock Exchange , the futures markets and the options markets , though physically separate , have actually become so closely intertwined as to constitute one market effectively .	PRP VBZ NN TO VB IN DT NNP NNP NNP NNP , DT NNS NNS CC DT NNS NNS , IN RB JJ , VBP RB VBN RB RB VBN IN TO VB CD NN RB .
Traders can vary their strategies and execute their orders in any one of them .	NNS MD VB PRP$ NNS CC VB PRP$ NNS IN DT CD IN PRP .
It therefore makes no sense for each market to adopt different circuit breakers .	PRP RB VBZ DT NN IN DT NN TO VB JJ NN NNS .
To achieve maximum liquidity and minimize price volatility , either all markets should be open to trading or none .	TO VB NN NN CC VB NN NN , CC DT NNS MD VB JJ TO NN CC NN .
Synchronized circuit breakers would not have halted the slide in prices on Friday , but they probably would have made for smoother , less volatile executions .	VBN NN NNS MD RB VB VBN DT NN IN NNS IN NNP , CC PRP RB MD VB VBN IN JJR , RBR JJ NNS .
It 's time for the exchanges and the Securities and Exchange Commission to agree on joint conditions for halting trading or staying open .	PRP POS NN IN DT NNS CC DT NNP CC NNP NNP TO VB IN JJ NNS IN VBG NN CC VBG JJ .
Let 's not have one market shut down for 30 minutes when the Dow declines 100 points and another shut down for an hour after a 250-point decline .	VB PRP RB VB CD NN VBD RP IN CD NNS WRB DT NNP VBZ CD NNS CC DT VBD RP IN DT NN IN DT JJ NN .
The need for hurried last-minute telephone negotiations among market officials will disappear once rules are in place that synchronize circuit breakers in all markets .	DT NN IN JJ JJ NN NNS IN NN NNS MD VB IN NNS VBP IN NN WDT VBP NN NNS IN DT NNS .
The new circuit breakers , if they are to be applied at all , will require that futures and options trading continue as long as the New York Stock Exchange remains open .	DT JJ NN NNS , IN PRP VBP TO VB VBN IN DT , MD VB IN NNS CC NNS NN VB RB RB IN DT NNP NNP NNP NNP VBZ JJ .

The restrictions would cover all but a small percentage of domestic air traffic , and represent a major expansion of the current smoking ban on flights of two hours or less .	DT NNS MD VB DT CC DT JJ NN IN JJ NN NN , CC VB DT JJ NN IN DT JJ NN NN IN NNS IN CD NNS CC JJR .
The exemption allowed on longer flights to Alaska and Hawaii appears to be largely a face-saving concession for the traditionally powerful tobacco industry , which has found itself increasingly isolated in the face of public pressure in recent years . Rates are determined by the difference between the purchase price and face value .	NNS VBP VBN IN DT NN IN DT NN NN CC NN NN .

If you guessed black-and-white snapshots , you 're right .	IN PRP VBD JJ NNS , PRP VBP JJ .
After years of fading into the background , two-tone photography is coming back .	IN NNS IN NN IN DT NN , JJ NN VBZ VBG RB .
Trendy magazine advertisements feature stark black-and-white photos of Hollywood celebrities pitching jeans , shoes and liquor .	JJ NN NNS VBP JJ JJ NNS IN NNP NNS VBG NNS , NNS CC NN .
Portrait studios accustomed to shooting only in color report a rush to black-and-white portrait orders .	NN NNS VBN TO VBG RB IN NN VBP DT NN TO JJ NN NNS .
And black-and-white photography classes are crowded with students .	CC JJ NN NNS VBP VBN IN NNS .
What 's happening in photography mirrors the popularity of black and white in fashion , home furnishings and cinematography .	WP VBZ VBG IN NN VBZ DT NN IN JJ CC JJ IN NN , NN NNS CC NN .
On Seventh Avenue , designers have been advancing the monochrome look with clothing collections done entirely in black and white .	IN NNP NNP , NNS VBP VBN VBG DT JJ NN IN NN NNS VBN RB IN JJ CC JJ .
And classic black-and-white movies are enjoying a comeback on videocassette tapes , spurred , in part , by the backlash against colorization of old films .	CC JJ JJ NNS VBP VBG DT NN IN NN NNS , VBD , IN NN , IN DT NN IN NN IN JJ NNS .
`` The pendulum is swinging back to black and white , '' says Richard DeMoulin , the general manager of Eastman Kodak Co. 's professional photography division .	`` DT NN VBZ VBG RB TO NN CC NN , '' VBZ NNP NNP , DT JJ NN IN NNP NNP NNP POS JJ NN NN .
Until two years ago , sales of black-and-white film had been declining steadily since the 1960s .	IN CD NNS RB , NNS IN JJ NN VBD VBN VBG RB IN DT CD .
But last year , buoyed by increased use in advertising and other commercial applications , sales increased 5 % , and they are expected to jump at least that much again this year .	CC JJ NN , VBN IN VBN NN IN VBG CC JJ JJ NNS , NNS VBD CD NN , CC PRP VBP VBN TO VB IN JJS DT RB RB DT NN .
Photographic companies are scrambling to tap the resurging market , reviving some black-and-white product lines and developing new ones .	JJ NNS VBP VBG TO VB DT VBG NN , VBG DT JJ NN NNS CC VBG JJ NNS .
At Kodak , which largely ignored the market for years , black-and-white film sales now account for nearly 15 % of the company 's $ 3 billion in film and paper sales annually , up from 10 % three years ago . Gatoil Suisse owns an oil refinery in Switzerland with a capacity of 70,000 barrels a day , along with a network of gasoline retailing outlets .	NNP NNP VBZ DT NN NN IN NNP IN DT NN IN CD NNS DT NN , IN IN DT NN IN NN VBG NNS .
While Friday 's plunging stock market prompted new fears about the economy 's prospects , a little-known indicator that has faithfully foreshadowed the economy 's ups and downs by exceptionally long lead times points to a sustained rise in overall business activity .	IN NNP POS VBG NN NN VBD JJ NNS IN DT NN POS NNS , DT JJ NN WDT VBZ RB VBN DT NN POS NNS CC NNS IN RB JJ NN NNS VBZ TO DT JJ NN IN JJ NN NN .
The barometer , developed by analysts at Columbia University 's Center for International Business Cycle Research here , reached a record high of 223.0 in August , the latest month available , and the Columbia researchers estimate that it has moved even higher since then .	DT NN , VBN IN NNS IN NNP NNP POS NNP IN NNP NNP NNP NNP RB , VBD DT NN JJ IN CD IN NNP , DT JJS NN JJ , CC DT NNP NNS VBP IN PRP VBZ VBN RB RBR IN RB .
The latest reading of 223.0 was up from 222.3 in July and 215.3 as recently as March .	DT JJS NN IN CD VBD RB IN CD IN NNP CC CD RB RB IN NNP .
The August rise marked the fifth straight monthly gain for the indicator , which uses the 1967 average as a base of 100 .	DT NNP NN VBD DT JJ JJ JJ NN IN DT NN , WDT VBZ DT CD NN IN DT NN IN CD .
In contrast , the Commerce Department 's widely followed index of leading indicators , while up in August , has fallen repeatedly since reaching a high early this year .	IN NN , DT NNP NNP POS RB VBN NN IN VBG NNS , IN RB IN NNP , VBZ VBN RB IN VBG DT JJ RB DT NN .
Its ragged behavior through much of 1989 has prompted some forecasters to anticipate the start of a new recession perhaps before year 's end .	PRP$ JJ NN IN JJ IN CD VBZ VBN DT NNS TO VB DT NN IN DT JJ NN RB IN NN POS NN .
But the far stronger showing of the Columbia index `` makes a recession any time soon highly unlikely , '' says Geoffrey H. Moore , the director of the Columbia facility .	CC DT RB JJR NN IN DT NNP NN `` VBZ DT NN DT NN RB RB JJ , '' VBZ NNP NNP NNP , DT NN IN DT NNP NN .
A leading authority on the business cycle , Mr. Moore also is a member of the Business Cycle Dating Group , the panel of private economists that decides for the government when expansions and recessions begin and end .	DT VBG NN IN DT NN NN , NNP NNP RB VBZ DT NN IN DT NNP NNP NNP NNP , DT NN IN JJ NNS WDT VBZ IN DT NN WRB NNS CC NNS VBP CC VBP .
The group normally convenes only when a change in the economy 's general course seems likely .	DT NN RB VBZ RB WRB DT NN IN DT NN POS JJ NN VBZ RB .
`` No meeting is scheduled because the expansion shows no sign of going off the tracks , '' Mr. Moore reports .	`` DT NN VBZ VBN IN DT NN VBZ DT NN IN VBG IN DT NNS , '' NNP NNP VBZ .
Based largely on the recent strength in their index , called the long leading indicator , the Columbia analysts foresee uninterrupted economic growth through the rest of this year and next year as well .	VBN RB IN DT JJ NN IN PRP$ NN , VBN DT JJ VBG NN , DT NNP NNS VBP JJ JJ NN IN DT NN IN DT NN CC JJ NN RB RB .
They expect a 2.6 % rise in 1990 in the gross national product , after adjustment for inflation .	PRP VBP DT CD NN NN IN CD IN DT JJ JJ NN , IN NN IN NN .
Underlying this optimism is the index 's longstanding ability to signal recessions or recoveries , as the case may be , by substantially greater periods than the Commerce Department 's index of leading indicators .	VBG DT NN VBZ DT NN POS JJ NN TO VB NNS CC NNS , IN DT NN MD VB , IN RB JJR NNS IN DT NNP NNP POS NN IN VBG NNS .
Over the full post-World War II era , the Columbia index , on the average , has entered sustained declines 14 months before the onset of recessions and turned up eight months before recoveries .	IN DT JJ NNP NNP NNP NN , DT NNP NN , IN DT NN , VBZ VBN VBN NNS CD NNS IN DT NN IN NNS CC VBD RP CD NNS IN NNS .
The comparable lead times for the Commerce index , whose components include the stock market , are far shorter -- 10 months before recessions and only three months before recoveries .	DT JJ NN NNS IN DT NNP NN , WP$ NNS VBP DT NN NN , VBP RB JJR : CD NNS IN NNS CC RB CD NNS IN NNS .
The Columbia economists also have reconstructed how the long leading index would have behaved , had it existed , in 1929 , before the stock market crash in October that ushered in the Great Depression .	DT NNP NNS RB VBP VBN WRB DT JJ VBG NN MD VB VBN , VBD PRP VBD , IN CD , IN DT NN NN NN IN NNP WDT VBD RP DT NNP NNP .
The indicator reached a peak in January 1929 and then fell steadily up to and through the crash .	DT NN VBD DT NN IN NNP CD CC RB VBD RB IN TO CC IN DT NN .
`` It was an entirely different pattern from what we 're seeing now , '' Mr. Moore says .	`` PRP VBD DT RB JJ NN IN WP PRP VBP VBG RB , '' NNP NNP VBZ .
A major source of the recent strength in the long leading indicator has been the performance of the Dow Jones corporate bond-price index , which is not a part of the Commerce index .	DT JJ NN IN DT JJ NN IN DT JJ VBG NN VBZ VBN DT NN IN DT NNP NNP JJ JJ NN , WDT VBZ RB DT NN IN DT NNP NN .
In August , the bond measure was at its highest monthly average since early 1987 .	IN NNP , DT NN NN VBD IN PRP$ JJS JJ NN IN JJ CD .
It also rose last Friday , while the stock market sagged .	PRP RB VBD JJ NNP , IN DT NN NN VBD .
Other components of the long leading indicator include a ratio of prices to unit labor costs in manufacturing industries , the M2 version of the money supply , adjusted for inflation , and the volume of new home-building permits .	JJ NNS IN DT JJ VBG NN VBP DT NN IN NNS TO NN NN NNS IN VBG NNS , DT CD NN IN DT NN NN , VBN IN NN , CC DT NN IN JJ JJ NNS .
Notably absent from the Columbia index is the stock market , which Mr. Moore says `` is simply no longer such a good indicator of the economy 's long-range prospects , though it still is useful for anticipating some short-run twists and turns . ''	RB JJ IN DT NNP NN VBZ DT NN NN , WDT NNP NNP VBZ `` VBZ RB DT RBR JJ DT JJ NN IN DT NN POS JJ NNS , IN PRP RB VBZ JJ IN VBG DT JJ NNS CC NNS . ''
As recently as 1975 , the stock market -- as reflected in the Standard & Poor 's index of 500 common stocks -- was rated by the National Bureau of Economic Research as the best of the 12 leading indicators that then made up the Commerce index .	RB RB IN CD , DT NN NN : IN VBN IN DT NNP CC NNP POS NN IN CD JJ NNS : VBD VBN IN DT NNP NNP IN NNP NNP IN DT JJS IN DT CD VBG NNS WDT RB VBD RP DT NNP NN .
It was assigned a mark of 80 out of a possible 100 , compared with scores ranging as low as 69 for the other components .	PRP VBD VBN DT NN IN CD IN IN DT JJ CD , VBN IN NNS VBG RB JJ IN CD IN DT JJ NNS .
The stock market has lost some precursory power , analysts at the Columbia center claim , because of the growing impact of international developments .	DT NN NN VBZ VBN DT JJ NN , NNS IN DT NNP NN NN , IN IN DT VBG NN IN JJ NNS .
`` Stocks have become more sensitive to factors not directly tied to the domestic economy , '' Mr. Moore says , citing the exchange rate for the dollar on currency markets , the foreign-trade balance and inflows of foreign capital .	`` NNS VBP VBN RBR JJ TO NNS RB RB VBN TO DT JJ NN , '' NNP NNP VBZ , VBG DT NN NN IN DT NN IN NN NNS , DT JJ NN CC NNS IN JJ NN .
He also feels that the rise of such computer-based practices as program trading has diminished the stock market 's relevancy to the economic outlook .	PRP RB VBZ IN DT NN IN JJ JJ NNS IN NN NN VBZ VBN DT NN NN POS NN TO DT JJ NN .

Intel Corp. said it reached an agreement with Alliant Computer Systems Corp. to develop software standards for Intel 's i860 microprocessor .	NNP NNP VBD PRP VBD DT NN IN NNP NNP NNP NNP TO VB NN NNS IN NNP POS NN NN .
The i860 , introduced earlier this year , is Intel 's entry in the crowded market for reduced instruction set computing , or RISC , computers .	DT NN , VBN RBR DT NN , VBZ NNP POS NN IN DT VBN NN IN VBN NN NN VBG , CC NNP , NNS .
Intel , based in Santa Clara , Calif. , is the market leader for traditional microprocessors with its 8086 family that forms the heart of IBM-compatible personal computers .	NNP , VBN IN NNP NNP , NNP , VBZ DT NN NN IN JJ NNS IN PRP$ CD NN WDT VBZ DT NN IN JJ JJ NNS .
Under the agreement , Intel will invest $ 3 million to acquire a 4 % stake in Alliant , a maker of minisupercomputers for scientists and engineers .	IN DT NN , NNP MD VB $ CD CD TO VB DT CD NN NN IN NNP , DT NN IN NNS IN NNS CC NNS .
Alliant , based in Littleton , Mass. , will license its parallel-computing technologies to Intel , providing users a way to let many i860 microprocessors in a single computer work on a problem simultaneously .	NNP , VBN IN NNP , NNP , MD VB PRP$ JJ NNS TO NNP , VBG NNS DT NN TO VB JJ NN NNS IN DT JJ NN VB IN DT NN RB .
Alliant said it plans to use the microprocessor in future products .	NNP VBD PRP VBZ TO VB DT NN IN JJ NNS .
It declined to discuss its plans for upgrading its current product line .	PRP VBD TO VB PRP$ NNS IN VBG PRP$ JJ NN NN .

Whirlpool Corp. , Benton Harbor , Mich. , said it has developed a process to recover environmentally harmful chlorofluorocarbons , or CFCs , that previously entered the atmosphere during in-home repair of refrigerators and freezers . Earlier repairs vented the CFCs out of the home through a hose directly into the atmosphere .	JJR NNS VBD DT NNS IN IN DT NN IN DT NN RB IN DT NN .
CFCs are widely used as solvents , coolants and fire suppressants .	NNS VBP RB VBN IN NNS , NNS CC NN NNS .
But their use has been linked to a potentially dangerous depletion of the Earth 's ozone layer , and a number of companies are seeking to curtail use , or at least emission , of the substance . Blue Arrow was able to pull off the $ 1.34 billion takeover of Manpower in 1987 largely because different British and American accounting standards produce higher reported earnings for British companies . Good will is the excess of cost of an acquired firm , operating unit or assets over the current or fair market value of those assets .	JJ NN VBZ DT NN IN NN IN DT VBN NN , VBG NN CC NNS IN DT JJ CC JJ NN NN IN DT NNS .

When the price of plastics took off in 1987 , Quantum Chemical Corp. went along for the ride .	WRB DT NN IN NNS VBD RP IN CD , NNP NNP NNP VBD RB IN DT NN .
The timing of Quantum 's chief executive officer , John Hoyt Stookey , appeared to be nothing less than inspired , because he had just increased Quantum 's reliance on plastics .	DT NN IN NNP POS JJ JJ NN , NNP NNP NNP , VBD TO VB NN RBR IN VBN , IN PRP VBD RB VBN NNP POS NN IN NNS .
The company outpaced much of the chemical industry as annual profit grew fivefold in two years .	DT NN VBD JJ IN DT JJ NN IN JJ NN VBD JJ IN CD NNS .
Mr. Stookey said of the boom , `` It 's going to last a whole lot longer than anybody thinks . ''	NNP NNP VBD IN DT NN , `` PRP VBZ VBG TO VB DT JJ NN RBR IN NN VBZ . ''
But now prices have nose-dived and Quantum 's profit is plummeting .	CC RB NNS VBP VBN CC NNP POS NN VBZ VBG .

To a degree , Quantum represents the new times that have arrived for producers of the so-called commodity plastics that pervade modern life .	TO DT NN , NNP VBZ DT JJ NNS WDT VBP VBN IN NNS IN DT JJ NN NNS WDT VBP JJ NN .

At Quantum , which is based in New York , the trouble is magnified by the company 's heavy dependence on plastics .	IN NNP , WDT VBZ VBN IN NNP NNP , DT NN VBZ VBN IN DT NN POS JJ NN IN NNS .

The Bush administration earlier this year said it would extend steel quotas , known as voluntary restraint agreements , until March 31 , 1992 .	DT NNP NN RBR DT NN VBD PRP MD VB NN NNS , VBN IN JJ NN NNS , IN NNP CD , CD .

The U.S. termed its plan , a `` trade liberalization program , '' despite the fact that it is merely an extension .	DT NNP VBD PRP$ NN , DT `` NN NN NN , '' IN DT NN IN PRP VBZ RB DT NN .
Mexico , which was one of the first countries to conclude its steel talks with the U.S. , virtually doubled its quota to 0.95 % of the U.S. steel market from 0.48 % under the previous quotas . South Korea , which had 1.9 % under the previous quotas , is set to get a small increase to about 1.95 % .	NNP NNP , WDT VBD CD NN IN DT JJ NNS , VBZ VBN TO VB DT JJ NN TO RB CD NN .
That increase rises to slightly more than 2 % of the U.S. market if a joint Korean-U.S. steel project is included .	DT NN VBZ TO RB JJR IN CD NN IN DT NNP NN IN DT JJ NNP NN NN VBZ VBN .
Meanwhile , Brazil is expected to increase its allowance from the 1.43 % share it has had in recent years .	RB , NNP VBZ VBN TO VB PRP$ NN IN DT CD NN NN PRP VBZ VBN IN JJ NNS .

The EC steel industry , which has been coping with strong European demand , has been supplying about 5 % of the U.S. market compared with recent quotas of about 6.7 % .	DT NNP NN NN , WDT VBZ VBN VBG IN JJ JJ NN , VBZ VBN VBG RB CD NN IN DT NNP NN VBN IN JJ NNS IN RB CD NN .

In the recent talks , the EC had its quota increased about 300,000 tons , to 7 % of the U.S. market from 6.7 % in 1988 .	IN DT JJ NNS , DT NNP VBD PRP$ NN VBN RB CD NNS , TO CD NN IN DT NNP NN IN CD NN IN CD .
But its quota has been as high as 6.9 % in 1984 .	CC PRP$ NN VBZ VBN RB JJ IN CD NN IN CD .
Japan , however , has agreed to cut its quota to about 5 % from 5.9 % previously .	NNP , RB , VBZ VBN TO VB PRP$ NN TO RB CD NN IN CD NN RB .
Japan , the EC , Brazil , Mexico and South Korea provide about 80 % of the steel imported to the U.S. under the quota program .	NNP , DT NNP , NNP , NNP CC NNP NNP VBP RB CD NN IN DT NN VBN TO DT NNP IN DT NN NN .

In the Babylonian Bronx , Jewish working-class people lived in drab , Soviet-style buildings `` glamorized '' with names like AnaMor Towers -LRB- after owners Anna and Morris Snezak -RRB- , whose lobbies and hallways were decorated with murals of ancient Syrians and Greeks , friezes of Pompeii . ''	IN NNP NNP DT JJ NN VBD DT NN PRP VBD VBG IN DT NNP NNP IN DT JJ NN : `` : RB JJ , RB JJ , VBG DT NN TO JJ NNS . ''

The games Bronx children played -LRB- holding kids down and stripping them , for example -RRB- seem tame by today 's crack standards , but Ms. Cunningham makes it all sound like a great adventure . Maybe Lily became so obsessed with where people slept and how because her own arrangements kept shifting .	RB NNP VBD RB JJ IN WRB NNS VBD CC WRB IN PRP$ JJ NNS VBD VBG .
When Rosie died , her uncles moved in -- and let her make the sleeping and other household arrangements .	WRB NNP VBD , PRP$ NNS VBD RP : CC VB PRP VB DT NN CC JJ NN NNS .

The four justices are no newcomers to dissent , often joining forces in the past decade to criticize the court 's conservative drift .	DT CD NNS VBP DT NNS TO NN , RB VBG NNS IN DT JJ NN TO VB DT NN POS JJ NN .
But always , in years past , they have bucked the trend and have been able to pick up a fifth vote to eke out a number of major victories in civil rights and liberties cases .	CC RB , IN NNS JJ , PRP VBP VBN DT NN CC VBP VBP JJ TO VB RP DT JJ NN TO VB RP DT NN IN JJ NNS IN JJ NNS CC NNS NNS .
Now , however , as the court 's new five-member conservative majority continues to solidify , victories for the liberals are rare .	RB , RB , IN DT NN POS JJ JJ JJ NN VBZ TO VB , NNS IN DT NNS VBP JJ .
The change is most dramatic for Justice Brennan , the last survivor of the mid-1960s liberal majority under Chief Justice Earl Warren .	DT NN VBZ RBS JJ IN NNP NNP , DT JJ NN IN DT NNS JJ NN IN NNP NNP NNP NNP .

Under these deals , the RTC sells just the deposits and the healthy assets .	IN DT NNS , DT NNP VBZ RB DT NNS CC DT JJ NNS .

Time magazine , in a move to reduce the costs of wooing new subscribers , is lowering its circulation guarantee to advertisers for the second consecutive year , increasing its subscription rates and cutting back on merchandise giveaways . In an announcement to its staff last week , executives at Time Warner Inc. 's weekly magazine said Time will `` dramatically de-emphasize '' its use of electronic giveaways such as telephones in television subscription drives ; cut the circulation it guarantees advertisers by 300,000 , to four million ; and increase the cost of its annual subscription rate by about $ 4 to $ 55 . In a related development , the news-weekly , for the fourth year in a row , said it wo n't increase its advertising rates in 1990 ; a full , four-color page in the magazine costs about $ 120,000 . Time is following the course of some other mass-circulation magazines that in recent years have challenged the publishing myth that maintaining artificially high , and expensive , circulations is the way to draw advertisers . In recent years , Reader 's Digest , New York Times Co. 's McCall 's , and most recently News Corp. 's TV Guide , have cut their massive circulation rate bases to eliminate marginal circulation and hold down rates for advertisers . The Second U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals opinion in the Arcadian Phosphate case did not repudiate the position Pennzoil Co. took in its dispute with Texaco , contrary to your Sept. 8 article `` Court Backs Texaco 's View in Pennzoil Case -- Too Late . The fundamental rule of contract law applied to both cases was that courts will not enforce agreements to which the parties did not intend to be bound .	DT JJ NN IN NN NN VBN TO DT NNS VBD IN NNS MD RB VB NNS TO WDT DT NNS VBD RB VB TO VB VBN .
In the Pennzoil/Texaco litigation , the courts found Pennzoil and Getty Oil intended to be bound ; in Arcadian Phosphates they found there was no intention to be bound .	IN DT NNP NN , DT NNS VBD NNP CC NNP NNP VBD TO VB VBN : IN NNP NNP PRP VBD EX VBD DT NN TO VB VBN .
Admittedly , the principle in the cases is the same .	RB , DT NN IN DT NNS VBZ DT JJ .
But the outcome of a legal dispute almost always turns on the facts .	CC DT NN IN DT JJ NN RB RB VBZ IN DT NNS .
And the facts , as found by the various courts in these two lawsuits , were different .	CC DT NNS , IN VBN IN DT JJ NNS IN DT CD NNS , VBD JJ .
When you suggest otherwise , you leave the realm of reporting and enter the orbit of speculation .	WRB PRP VBP RB , PRP VBP DT NN IN NN CC VB DT NN IN NN .

Interprovincial , Canada 's biggest oil pipeline operator and a major transporter of crude to the U.S. , said revised industry forecasts indicate that Canadian oil output will total about 1.64 million barrels a day by 1991 , 8 % lower than a previous estimate . Canadian crude production averaged about 1.69 million barrels a day during 1989 's first half , about 1 % below the 1988 level .	JJ NN NN VBD RB CD CD NNS DT NN IN CD POS JJ NN , RB CD NN IN DT CD NN .
`` The capability of existing fields to deliver oil is dropping , '' and oil exploration activity is also down dramatically , as many producers shift their emphasis to natural gas , said Ronald Watkins , vice president for government and industry relations with Interprovincial 's parent , Interhome Energy Inc .	`` DT NN IN JJ NNS TO VB NN VBZ VBG , '' CC NN NN NN VBZ RB RB RB , IN JJ NNS VBP PRP$ NN TO JJ NN , VBD NNP NNP , NN NN IN NN CC NN NNS IN NNP POS NN , NNP NNP NNP .

`` There has been a swing of the pendulum back to the gas side , '' he said .	`` EX VBZ VBN DT NN IN DT NN RB TO DT NN NN , '' PRP VBD .

Mr. Watkins said the main reason for the production decline is shrinking output of light crude from mature , conventional fields in western Canada .	NNP NNP VBD DT JJ NN IN DT NN NN VBZ VBG NN IN JJ NN IN JJ , JJ NNS IN JJ NNP .

The population of all four states is on the upswing , according to new Census Bureau estimates , following declines throughout the early 1980s .	DT NN IN DT CD NNS VBZ IN DT NN , VBG TO JJ NNP NNP NNS , VBG NNS IN DT JJ NNS .

Between 1987 and 1988 , North Dakota was the only state in the Midwest to lose population , a loss of 4,000 people .	IN CD CC CD , NNP NNP VBD DT JJ NN IN DT JJS TO VB NN , DT NN IN CD NNS .
Six of the 12 midwestern states have been growing steadily since 1980 -- Illinois , Kansas , Minnesota , Missouri , South Dakota and Wisconsin .	CD IN DT CD JJ NNS VBP VBN VBG RB IN CD : NNP , NNP , NNP , NNP , NNP NNP CC NNP .

And although Pennsylvania and Massachusetts suffered slight declines earlier in the decade , they are growing again .	CC IN NNP CC NNP VBD JJ NNS RBR IN DT NN , PRP VBP VBG RB .
At the same time , several states in the South and West have had their own population turnaround .	IN DT JJ NN , JJ NNS IN DT NNP CC NNP VBP VBN PRP$ JJ NN NN .

THANKS TO modern medicine , more couples are growing old together .	NNS TO JJ NN , JJR NNS VBP VBG JJ RB .

A new Census Bureau study of the noninstitutionalized population shows that 64 % of people aged 65 to 74 were living with a spouse in 1988 , up from 59 % in 1970 .	DT JJ NNP NNP NN IN DT JJ NN VBZ IN CD NN IN NNS VBN CD TO CD VBD VBG IN DT NN IN CD , RB IN CD NN IN CD .

What has changed is that more of the young elderly are living with spouses rather than with other relatives , such as children .	WP VBZ VBN VBZ IN JJR IN DT JJ JJ VBP VBG IN NNS RB IN IN JJ NNS , JJ IN NNS .

These critics fail to distinguish between the type of ethnic humor that aims at disparaging another group , such as `` Polish jokes '' ; and the type that is double-edged , aiming inward as well as outward .	DT NNS VBP TO VB IN DT NN IN JJ NN WDT VBZ IN VBG DT NN , JJ IN `` JJ NNS '' : CC DT NN WDT VBZ JJ , VBG RB RB RB IN RB .
The latter typically is the humor of the underdog , and it was perfected by both blacks and Jews on the minstrel and vaudeville stage as a means of mocking their white and gentile audiences along with themselves . Why constructive ?	WRB JJ .
Because despite all the media prattle about comedy and politics not mixing , they are similar in one respect : Both can serve as mechanisms for easing tensions and facilitating the co-existence of groups in conflict . Raymond Weber	NNP NNP
Parsippany , N.J .	NNP , NNP .
I disagree with the statement by Mr. Lantos that one should not draw an adverse inference against former HUD officials who assert their Fifth Amendment privilege against self-incrimination in congressional hearings .	PRP VBP IN DT NN IN NNP NNP IN PRP MD RB VB DT JJ NN IN JJ NNP NNS WP VBP PRP$ NNP NNP NN IN NN IN JJ NNS .
The Fifth Amendment states in relevant part that no person `` shall be compelled , in any criminal case , to be a witness against himself . ''	DT NNP NNP VBZ IN JJ NN IN DT NN `` MD VB VBN , IN DT JJ NN , TO VB DT NN IN PRP . ''
This privilege against self-incrimination precludes the drawing of an adverse inference against a criminal defendant who chooses not to testify .	DT NN IN NN VBZ DT NN IN DT JJ NN IN DT JJ NN WP VBZ RB TO VB .
Thus , in a criminal case , a prosecutor can not comment on a defendant 's failure to testify nor can the defendant be compelled to take the stand as a witness , thus forcing him to `` take the Fifth . ''	RB , IN DT JJ NN , DT NN MD RB VB IN DT NN POS NN TO VB CC MD DT NN VB VBN TO VB DT NN IN DT NN , RB VBG PRP TO `` VB DT NNP . ''
The privilege , however , has been limited in accordance with its plain language to protect the defendant in criminal matters only .	DT NN , RB , VBZ VBN VBN IN NN IN PRP$ JJ NN TO VB DT NN IN JJ NNS RB .
The Supreme Court and some states have specifically recognized that `` the Fifth Amendment does not preclude the inference where the privilege is claimed by a party to a civil cause . ''	DT NNP NNP CC DT NNS VBP RB VBN IN `` DT NNP NNP VBZ RB VB DT NN WRB DT NN VBZ VBN IN DT NN TO DT JJ NN . ''
Baxter v. Palmingiano , 425 U.S. 308 -LRB- 1976 -RRB- .	NNP IN NNP , CD NNP CD -LRB- CD -RRB- .
Thus , in a civil case , a defendant may be called as a witness , he may be forced to testify or take the Fifth , and his taking of the Fifth may permit the drawing of an adverse inference against him in the civil matter .	RB , IN DT JJ NN , DT NN MD VB VBN IN DT NN , PRP MD VB VBN TO VB CC VB DT NNP , CC PRP$ NN IN DT NNP MD VB DT NN IN DT JJ NN IN PRP IN DT JJ NN .
He may take the Fifth in a civil matter only if he has a good faith and justifiable belief that his testimony may subject him to criminal prosecution .	PRP MD VB DT NNP IN DT JJ NN RB IN PRP VBZ DT JJ NN CC JJ NN IN PRP$ NN MD VB PRP TO JJ NN .
Allowing the defendant to take the Fifth in a civil matter is not based on a constitutional right to refuse to testify where one 's testimony harms him in the civil matter , but because the testimony in the civil matter could be unconstitutionally used against him in a subsequent criminal prosecution .	VBG DT NN TO VB DT NNP IN DT JJ NN VBZ RB VBN IN DT JJ NN TO VB TO VB WRB PRP POS NN VBZ PRP IN DT JJ NN , CC IN DT NN IN DT JJ NN MD VB RB VBN IN PRP IN DT JJ JJ NN .
Absent the risk of such prosecution , a court may order the defendant to testify .	JJ DT NN IN JJ NN , DT NN MD VB DT NN TO VB .
Thus , when Mr. Pierce asserted the Fifth in a noncriminal proceeding , particularly after presumably receiving extensive advice from legal counsel , one must conclude that he held a good-faith , justifiable belief that his testimony could be used against him in a subsequent criminal prosecution .	RB , WRB NNP NNP VBD DT NNP IN DT JJ NN , RB IN RB VBG JJ NN IN JJ NN , PRP MD VB IN PRP VBD DT NN , JJ NN IN PRP$ NN MD VB VBN IN PRP IN DT JJ JJ NN .
The subcommittee , Congress and the American public have every right to draw the adverse inference and to concur with Mr. Pierce 's own belief that his testimony could help convict him of a crime .	DT NN , NNP CC DT JJ NN VBP DT NN TO VB DT JJ NN CC TO VB IN NNP NNP POS JJ NN IN PRP$ NN MD VB VB PRP IN DT NN .
Drawing the adverse inference in a noncriminal congressional hearing does not offend the Fifth Amendment shield against self-incrimination .	VBG DT JJ NN IN DT JJ JJ NN VBZ RB VB DT NNP NNP NN IN NN .

It was Friday the 13th , and the stock market plummeted nearly 200 points .	PRP VBD NNP DT NNP , CC DT NN NN VBD RB CD NNS .
Just a coincidence ?	RB DT NN .
Or is triskaidekaphobia -- fear of the number 13 -- justified ?	CC VBZ NN : NN IN DT NN CD : VBN .
In academia , a so-called Friday the 13th effect has been set up and shot down by different professors .	IN NN , DT JJ NNP DT NNP NN VBZ VBN VBN RP CC VBD RP IN JJ NNS .
Robert Kolb and Ricardo Rodriguez , professors of finance at the University of Miami , found evidence that the market is spooked by Friday the 13th .	NNP NNP CC NNP NNP , NNS IN NN IN DT NNP IN NNP , VBD NN IN DT NN VBZ VBN IN NNP DT NNP .
But their study , which spanned the 1962-85 period , has since been shown to be jinxed by an unlucky choice of data .	CC PRP$ NN , WDT VBD DT CD NN , VBZ RB VBN VBN TO VB VBN IN DT JJ NN IN NNS .
In the '70s , the market took falls nine times in a row on Friday the you-know-what .	IN DT NNS , DT NN VBD NNS CD NNS IN DT NN IN NNP DT NN .
But the date tends to be a plus , not a minus , for stocks , according to Yale Hirsch , a collector of stock market lore .	CC DT NN VBZ TO VB DT NN , RB DT NN , IN NNS , VBG TO NNP NNP , DT NN IN NN NN NN .
Another study found that the 82 Fridays the 13th in the 1940-1987 period had higher than average returns -- higher even than Fridays in general , which tend to be strong days for stock prices .	DT NN VBD IN DT CD NNP DT JJ IN DT CD NN VBD JJR IN JJ NNS : JJR RB IN NNPS IN JJ , WDT VBP TO VB JJ NNS IN NN NNS .
On the only other Friday the 13th this year , the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose about four points .	IN DT JJ JJ NNP DT NNP DT NN , DT NNP NNP NNP NNP VBD RB CD NNS .
Professor Kolb says the original study , titled Friday the 13th , Part VII , was published tongue-in-cheek .	NNP NNP VBZ DT JJ NN , VBN NNP DT NNP , NNP NNP , VBD VBN RB .
In a similar vein , he adds that the anniversary of the 1987 crash and Saturday 's full moon could have played a part , too , in Friday 's market activity .	IN DT JJ NN , PRP VBZ IN DT NN IN DT CD NN CC NNP POS JJ NN MD VB VBN DT NN , RB , IN NNP POS NN NN .
reminiscent of those during the 1987 crash -- that as stock prices plummeted and trading activity escalated , some phone calls to market makers in over-the-counter stocks went unanswered .	JJ IN DT IN DT CD NN : IN IN NN NNS VBD CC NN NN VBD , DT NN NNS TO NN NNS IN JJ NNS VBD JJ .

Market makers keep supplies of stock on hand to maintain orderly trading when imbalances occur .	NN NNS VBP NNS IN NN IN NN TO VB JJ NN WRB NNS VBP .
On days like Friday , that means they must buy shares from sellers when no one else is willing to .	IN NNS IN NNP , WDT VBZ PRP MD VB NNS IN NNS WRB DT NN RB VBZ JJ TO .
When selling is so frenzied , prices fall steeply and fast .	WRB NN VBZ RB JJ , NNS VBP RB CC RB .
Two years ago , faced with the possibility of heavy losses on the stocks in their inventories , market makers themselves began dumping shares , exacerbating the slide in OTC stock prices .	CD NNS RB , VBN IN DT NN IN JJ NNS IN DT NNS IN PRP$ NNS , NN NNS PRP VBD VBG NNS , VBG DT NN IN NNP NN NNS .

Pension funds , insurers and other behemoths of the investing world said they began scooping up stocks during Friday 's market rout .	NN NNS , NNS CC JJ NNS IN DT NN NN VBD PRP VBD VBG RP NNS IN NNP POS NN NN .
And they plan to buy more today .	CC PRP VBP TO VB JJR NN .
Rightly or wrongly , many giant institutional investors appear to be fighting the latest war by applying the lesson they learned in the October 1987 crash : Buying at the bottom pays off .	RB CC RB , JJ JJ JJ NNS VBP TO VB VBG DT JJS NN IN VBG DT NN PRP VBD IN DT NNP CD NN : VBG IN DT NN VBZ RP .
To be sure , big investors might put away their checkbooks in a hurry if stocks open sharply lower today .	TO VB JJ , JJ NNS MD VB RP PRP$ NNS IN DT NN IN NNS VBP RB JJR NN .
They could still panic and bail out of the market .	PRP MD RB VB CC VB RP IN DT NN .
But their 1987 performance indicates that they wo n't abandon stocks unless conditions get far worse .	CC PRP$ CD NN VBZ IN PRP MD RB VB NNS IN NNS VBP RB JJR .
`` Last time , we got rewarded for going out and buying stocks when the panic was the worst , '' said John W. Rogers , president of Chicago-based Ariel Capital Management Inc. , which manages $ 1.1 billion of stocks .	`` JJ NN , PRP VBD VBN IN VBG RB CC VBG NNS WRB DT NN VBD DT JJS , '' VBD NNP NNP NNP , NN IN JJ NNP NNP NNP NNP , WDT VBZ $ CD CD IN NNS .

Most institutional investors have abandoned the portfolio insurance hedging technique , which is widely thought to have worsened the 1987 crash .	RBS JJ NNS VBP VBN DT NN NN NN NN , WDT VBZ RB VBN TO VB VBN DT CD NN .
Not really insurance , this tactic was designed to soften the blow of declining stock prices and generate an offsetting profit by selling waves of S&P futures contracts .	RB RB NN , DT NN VBD VBN TO VB DT NN IN VBG NN NNS CC VB DT VBG NN IN VBG NNS IN NNP NNS NNS .

In many ways , the backdrop to Friday 's stock decline is eerily similar to that of October 1987 's 508-point crash .	IN JJ NNS , DT NN TO NNP POS NN NN VBZ RB JJ TO DT IN NNP CD POS JJ NN .

The 1987 crash brought the Reagan administration and Democratic lawmakers to the table for the first budget summit , resulting in a two-year plan to reduce the deficit by more than $ 76 billion -- even though the deficit actually rose by nearly $ 12 billion during that period . The crowded field for notebook-sized computers is about to become a lot more crowded .	DT JJ NN IN JJ NNS VBZ RB TO VB DT NN RBR JJ .
Compaq Computer Corp. 's long-awaited entry today into the notebook field is expected to put immediate heat on others in the market , especially Zenith Electronics Corp. , the current market leader , and on a swarm of promising start-ups . Compaq 's series of notebooks extends a trend toward downsizing in the personal computer market .	NNP POS NN IN NNS VBZ DT NN IN NN IN DT JJ NN NN .
One manufacturer already has produced a clipboard-sized computer called a notepad , and two others have introduced even smaller `` palmtops . ''	CD NN RB VBZ VBN DT JJ NN VBD DT NN , CC CD NNS VBP VBN RB JJR `` NNS . ''
But those machines are still considered novelties , with keyboards only a munchkin could love and screens to match .	CC DT NNS VBP RB VBN NNS , IN NNS RB DT NN MD VB CC VBZ TO VB .
Compaq 's notebooks , by contrast , may be the first in their weight class not to skimp on features found in much bigger machines .	NNP POS NNS , IN NN , MD VB DT JJ IN PRP$ NN NN RB TO VB IN NNS VBN IN RB JJR NNS .

Investors who bought stock with borrowed money -- that is , `` on margin '' -- may be more worried than most following Friday 's market drop .	NNS WP VBD NN IN JJ NN : DT VBZ , `` IN NN '' : MD VB RBR JJ IN JJS VBG NNP POS NN NN .
That 's because their brokers can require them to sell some shares or put up more cash to enhance the collateral backing their loans .	DT VBZ IN PRP$ NNS MD VB PRP TO VB DT NNS CC VB RP JJR NN TO VB DT NN VBG PRP$ NNS .
In October 1987 , these margin calls were thought to have contributed to the downward spiral of the stock market .	IN NNP CD , DT NN NNS VBD VBN TO VB VBN TO DT JJ NN IN DT NN NN .
Typically , a margin call occurs when the price of a stock falls below 75 % of its original value .	RB , DT NN NN VBZ WRB DT NN IN DT NN VBZ IN CD NN IN PRP$ JJ NN .
If the investor does n't put up the extra cash to satisfy the call , the brokerage firm may begin liquidating the securities .	IN DT NN VBZ RB VB RP DT JJ NN TO VB DT NN , DT NN NN MD VB VBG DT NNS .

Do n't jump yet .	VB RB VB RB .
The stock market 's swoon may turn out to be good news for the economy .	DT NN NN POS NN MD VB RP TO VB JJ NN IN DT NN .
In one wild hour of trading , the market managed to accomplish what the Bush administration has been trying to do , unsuccessfully , for weeks .	IN CD JJ NN IN VBG , DT NN VBD TO VB WP DT NNP NN VBZ VBN VBG TO VB , RB , IN NNS .
It is forcing the Federal Reserve to ease its grip on credit and it took the wind out of a previously irrepressible dollar .	PRP VBZ VBG DT NNP NNP TO VB PRP$ NN IN NN CC PRP VBD DT NN IN IN DT RB JJ NN .
The resulting decline in interest rates and the value of the dollar could reinvigorate American business -- indeed , the entire economy .	DT VBG NN IN NN NNS CC DT NN IN DT NN MD VB JJ NN : RB , DT JJ NN .
This may sound strangely optimistic .	DT MD VB RB JJ .
After all , until a few years ago , the stock market was viewed as a barometer of the national economy .	IN DT , IN DT JJ NNS RB , DT NN NN VBD VBN IN DT NN IN DT JJ NN .
When it went down , by all tradition , the economy followed .	WRB PRP VBD RB , IN DT NN , DT NN VBD .
That has changed , partly because the two years following the worst stock-market plunge in history have been reasonably comfortable .	DT VBZ VBN , RB IN DT CD NNS VBG DT JJS NN NN IN NN VBP VBN RB JJ .
The 1987 crash was `` a false alarm however you view it , '' says University of Chicago economist Victor Zarnowitz .	DT CD NN VBD `` DT JJ NN WRB PRP VBP PRP , '' VBZ NNP IN NNP NN NNP NNP .
The market seems increasingly disconnected from the rest of the nation .	DT NN VBZ RB JJ IN DT NN IN DT NN .
Its spasms ca n't be traced to fundamental business conditions , nor do they appear to presage major shifts in the economy .	PRP$ NNS MD RB VB VBN TO JJ NN NNS , CC VB PRP VBP TO VB JJ NNS IN DT NN .
`` The market today has a life of its own , '' John Akers , chairman of International Business Machines Corp. , said Saturday .	`` DT NN NN VBZ DT NN IN PRP$ JJ , '' NNP NNP , NN IN NNP NNP NNP NNP , VBD NNP .
`` There 's nothing rational about this kind of action . ''	`` EX VBZ NN JJ IN DT NN IN NN . ''
Of course , the health of the economy will be threatened if the market continues to dive this week .	IN NN , DT NN IN DT NN MD VB VBN IN DT NN VBZ TO VB DT NN .
Sharply falling stock prices do reduce consumer wealth , damage business confidence and discourage the foreign investors upon whom the U.S. now relies for financial sustenance .	RB VBG NN NNS VBP VB NN NN , VB NN NN CC VB DT JJ NNS IN WP DT NNP RB VBZ IN JJ NN .
The financial-services industry was battered by the 1987 crash .	DT NNS NN VBD VBN IN DT CD NN .
What 's more , although the stock market is far less overvalued today than two years ago , the U.S. economy is weaker .	WP VBZ JJR , IN DT NN NN VBZ RB RBR JJ NN IN CD NNS RB , DT NNP NN VBZ JJR .
Growth is slower .	NN VBZ JJR .
Profits are softer .	NNS VBP JJR .
Debt burdens are heavier .	NN NNS VBP JJR .
But if the stock market does n't continue to plummet , the beneficial effects of lower interest rates and a lower dollar may well dominate .	CC IN DT NN NN VBZ RB VB TO VB , DT JJ NNS IN JJR NN NNS CC DT JJR NN MD RB VB .
The Fed , which until Friday had been resisting moves to ease credit , is now poised to pour money into the economy if needed to soothe the markets .	DT NNP , WDT IN NNP VBD VBN VBG NNS TO VB NN , VBZ RB VBN TO VB NN IN DT NN IN VBN TO VB DT NNS .
Fed officials may protest that this does n't necessarily mean a fundamental change in their interest-rate policies .	NNP NNS MD VB IN DT VBZ RB RB VB DT JJ NN IN PRP$ NN NNS .
But the experience of the 1987 crash suggests the Fed is likely to bring down short-term interest rates in its effort to calm markets .	CC DT NN IN DT CD NN VBZ DT NNP VBZ JJ TO VB RP JJ NN NNS IN PRP$ NN TO VB NNS .
Anticipating the Fed 's move , money traders lowered a key interest rate known as the Federal Funds rate to 8.625 % late Friday , down from 8.820 % the day before .	VBG DT NNP POS NN , NN NNS VBD DT JJ NN NN VBN IN DT NNP NNP NN TO CD NN RB NNP , RB IN CD NN DT NN RB .
Tiny movements in the rate , which is what banks charge each other for overnight loans , are usually among the few visible tracks that the Fed leaves on the monetary markets .	JJ NNS IN DT NN , WDT VBZ WP NNS VBP DT JJ IN JJ NNS , VBP RB IN DT JJ JJ NNS WDT DT NNP VBZ IN DT JJ NNS .
The dollar also began to decline Friday as the stock market 's plunge caused some investors to reassess their desire to invest in the U.S. .	DT NN RB VBD TO VB NNP IN DT NN NN POS NN VBD DT NNS TO VB PRP$ NN TO VB IN DT NNP .
Treasury officials have been arguing for months that the dollar 's strength was out of whack with economic fundamentals , threatening to extinguish the export boom that has sustained manufacturers for several years . The market drop has now apparently convinced foreign investors that the Treasury was right about the overpriced dollar .	DT NN NN VBZ RB RB VBN JJ NNS IN DT NNP VBD JJ IN DT JJ NN .
A modest drop in the dollar -- only a modest one , mind you -- would be welcomed by the U.S. .	DT JJ NN IN DT NN : RB DT JJ CD , VB PRP : MD VB VBN IN DT NNP .
That was n't the case in 1987 , when the dollar was so weak that some economists and government officials seriously worried that it might collapse , producing panic among foreign investors and diminishing the flow of foreign capital to the U.S. . Another big difference between 1987 and 1989 is n't so comforting .	DT JJ NN IN CD CC CD VBZ RB RB JJ .
In the third quarter of 1987 , the economy spurted at an inflation-adjusted annual rate of 5.3 % .	IN DT JJ NN IN CD , DT NN VBD IN DT JJ JJ NN IN CD NN .
The consensus among economists is that it grew a much more sluggish 2.3 % in the third quarter of 1989 , which ended two weeks ago .	DT NN IN NNS VBZ IN PRP VBD DT RB RBR JJ CD NN IN DT JJ NN IN CD , WDT VBD CD NNS RB .

Proposals for government-operated `` national service , '' like influenza , flare up from time to time , depress the resistance of the body politic , run their course , and seem to disappear , only to mutate and afflict public life anew .	NNS IN JJ `` JJ NN , '' IN NN , VBP RP IN NN TO NN , VBP DT NN IN DT NN JJ , VBP PRP$ NN , CC VBP TO VB , RB TO VB CC VB JJ NN RB .
The disease metaphor comes to mind , of course , not as an aspersion on the advocates of national service .	DT NN NN VBZ TO NN , IN NN , RB IN DT NN IN DT NNS IN JJ NN .
Rather , it is born of frustration with having to combat constantly changing strains of a statist idea that one thought had been eliminated in the early 1970s , along with smallpox .	RB , PRP VBZ VBN IN NN IN VBG TO VB RB VBG NNS IN DT JJ NN IN NN VBD VBD VBN VBN IN DT JJ CD , IN IN NN .
It is back with us again , in the form of legislation to pay volunteers under a `` National and Community Service Act , '' a proposal with a serious shot at congressional passage this fall . Why does the national-service virus keep coming back ?	WRB VBZ DT JJ NN VB VBG RB .
Perhaps it is because utopian nostalgia evokes both military experience and the social gospel .	RB PRP VBZ RB JJ NN VBZ DT JJ NN CC DT JJ NN .
If only we could get America 's wastrel youth into at least a psychic uniform we might be able to teach self-discipline again and revive the spirit of giving .	IN RB PRP MD VB NNP POS NN NN IN IN JJS DT JJ NN PRP MD VB JJ TO VB NN RB CC VB DT NN IN VBG .
A quarter of a century ago national service was promoted as a way of curing the manifest inequities of the draft -- by , of all things , expanding the draft .	DT NN IN DT NN IN JJ NN VBD VBN IN DT NN IN VBG DT JJ NNS IN DT NN : IN , IN DT NNS , VBG DT NN .
Those of us who resisted the idea then suspect today that an obligation of government service for all young people is still the true long-term aim of many national-service backers , despite their protests that present plans contain no coercion . Choice of the volunteer military in the 1970s seemed to doom national service as much as the draft .	NN IN DT NN NN IN DT CD VBD TO VB JJ NN RB RB IN DT NN .
But the virus was kept alive in sociology departments until a couple of years ago , when it again was let loose .	CC DT NN VBD VBN JJ IN NN NNS IN DT NN IN NNS IN , WRB PRP RB VBD VBN RB .
This time it attempted to invade two connected problems , the rising cost of higher education and the rising expense to the federal government of educational grants and loans .	DT NN PRP VBD TO VB CD VBN NNS , DT VBG NN IN JJR NN CC DT VBG NN TO DT JJ NN IN JJ NNS CC NNS .
Why not keep and even expand the loans and grants , the advocates reasoned , but require some form of service from each recipient ?	WRB RB VB CC RB VB DT NNS CC NNS , DT NNS VBD , CC VB DT NN IN NN IN DT NN .
Military service , moreover , could be a national-service option .	JJ NN , RB , MD VB DT NN NN .
Thus , undoubtedly it was hoped that the new strain of national service would prove contagious , infecting patriotic conservatives , pay-as-you-go moderates , and idealistic liberals .	RB , RB PRP VBD VBN IN DT JJ NN IN JJ NN MD VB JJ , VBG JJ NNS , JJ NNS , CC JJ NNS .
The Democratic Leadership Council , a centrist group sponsoring the plan , surely thought it might help the party to attract support , especially among college students and their parents .	DT NNP NNP NNP , DT JJ NN VBG DT NN , RB VBD PRP MD VB DT NN TO VB NN , RB IN NN NNS CC PRP$ NNS .
A provision allowing grants to be applied to first-home purchases was added to appeal to those who had had enough of schooling .	DT NN VBG NNS TO VB VBN TO JJ NNS VBD VBN TO VB TO DT WP VBD VBN RB IN NN .
The DLC plan envisaged `` volunteers '' planting trees , emptying bedpans , tutoring children , and assisting librarians for $ 100 a week , tax free , plus medical care .	DT NNP NN VBN `` NNS '' VBG NNS , VBG NNS , VBG NNS , CC VBG NNS IN $ CD DT NN , NN JJ , CC JJ NN .
With a tax-free $ 10,000 voucher payment at the end of each year , the volunteers would be making a wage comparable to $ 17,500 a year .	IN DT JJ $ CD NN NN IN DT NN IN DT NN , DT NNS MD VB VBG DT NN JJ TO $ CD DT NN .
Mind you , most of `` the volunteers '' would be unskilled 17 - to 18-year-olds , some not even high school graduates , and many saving money by living at home .	VB PRP , JJS IN `` DT NNS '' MD VB JJ CD : TO NNS , DT RB RB JJ NN NNS , CC JJ VBG NN IN VBG IN NN .
They would be doing better financially under national service than many taxpayers working at the same kinds of jobs and perhaps supporting families .	PRP MD VB VBG RB RB IN JJ NN IN JJ NNS VBG IN DT JJ NNS IN NNS CC RB VBG NNS .
As it happened , political resistance developed among educational and minority interests that count on the present education grant system , so the national-service devotees decided to abandon the supposedly crucial principle of `` give in order to get . Edward Kennedy 's Labor Committee , that great stove of government expansionism , where many a stagnant pot of porridge is kept on the back burner until it can be brought forward and presented as nouvelle cuisine ? The debate over National Service has begun again .	DT NN IN NNP NNP VBZ VBN RB .
After a decade in which more than 50 localities established their own service or conservation corps and dozens of school systems made community service a prerequisite to high-school graduation , the focus has shifted to Washington . At least 10 bills proposing one or another national program were introduced in Congress this spring .	IN JJS CD NNS VBG CD CC DT JJ NN VBD VBN IN NNP DT NN .
One , co-sponsored by Sen. Sam Nunn -LRB- D. , Ga . -RRB- and Rep. Dave McCurdy -LRB- D. , Okla. -RRB- , would have restricted federal college subsidies to students who had served . President Bush has outlined his own Youth Entering Service -LRB- YES -RRB- plan , though its details remain to be specified .	NNP NNP VBZ VBN PRP$ JJ NNP NNP NNP -LRB- NNP -RRB- NN , IN PRP$ NNS VBP TO VB VBN .
What is one to think of all this ?	WP VBZ NN TO VB IN PDT DT .
Doctrine and special interests govern some responses .	NN CC JJ NNS VBP DT NNS .
People eager to have youth `` pay their dues to society '' favor service proposals -- preferably mandatory ones .	NNS JJ TO VB NN `` VBP PRP$ NNS TO NN '' VBP NN NNS : RB JJ NNS .
So do those who seek a `` re-energized concept of citizenship , '' a concept imposing stern obligations as well as conferring rights .	RB VBP DT WP VBP DT `` JJ NN IN NN , '' DT NN VBG JJ NNS RB RB IN VBG NNS .
Then there are instinctive opponents .	RB EX VBP JJ NNS .
To libertarians , mandatory service is an abomination and voluntary systems are illegitimate uses of tax money .	TO NNS , JJ NN VBZ DT NN CC JJ NNS VBP JJ NNS IN NN NN .
Devotees of the market question the value of the work national service would perform :	NNS IN DT NN VBP DT NN IN DT NN JJ NN MD VB :
If the market wo n't pay for it , they argue , it ca n't be worth its cost .	IN DT NN MD RB VB IN PRP , PRP VBP , PRP MD RB VB JJ PRP$ NN .
Elements of the left are also reflexively opposed ; they see service as a cover for the draft , or fear the regimentation of youth , or want to see rights enlarged , not obligations .	NNS IN DT JJ VBP RB RB VBN : PRP VBP NN IN DT NN IN DT NN , CC VBP DT NN IN NN , CC VB TO VB NNS VBN , RB NNS .
But what about those of us whose views are not predetermined by formula or ideology ?	CC WP IN DT IN PRP WP$ NNS VBP RB VBN IN NN CC NN .
How should we think about national service ?	WRB MD PRP VB IN JJ NN .
Let 's begin by recognizing a main source of confusion -- `` national service '' has no agreed meaning .	VB PRP VB IN VBG DT JJ NN IN NN : `` JJ NN '' VBZ RB VBN NN .
Would service be voluntary or compulsory ?	MD NN VB JJ CC JJ .
Short or long ?	JJ CC JJ .
Part-time or full-time ?	JJ CC JJ .
Paid or unpaid ?	VBN CC JJ .
Would participants live at home and work nearby or live in barracks and work on public lands ?	MD NNS VB IN NN CC VB RB CC VB IN NN CC VB IN JJ NNS .
What kinds of work would they do ?	WDT NNS IN NN MD PRP VB .
What does `` national '' mean ?	WP VBZ `` JJ '' VB .
Would the program be run by the federal government , by local governments , or by private voluntary organizations ?	MD DT NN VB VBN IN DT JJ NN , IN JJ NNS , CC IN JJ JJ NNS .
And who would serve ?	CC WP MD VB .
Only males , as with the draft , or both sexes ?	JJ NNS , RB IN DT NN , CC DT NNS .
Youth only or all ages ?	NN RB CC DT NNS .
Middle-class people , or poor people , or a genuine cross-section ?	JJ NNS , CC JJ NNS , CC DT JJ NN .
Many or few ?	JJ CC JJ .
Those are not trivial questions , and the label `` national service '' answers none of them .	DT VBP RB JJ NNS , CC DT NN `` JJ NN '' VBZ NN IN PRP .
Then how should we think about national service ?	RB WRB MD PRP VB IN JJ NN .
As a starting point , here are five propositions : 1 . Consider the ingredients , not the name .	IN DT VBG NN , RB VBP CD NNS : LS . VB DT NNS , RB DT NN .
Ignore `` national service '' in the abstract ; consider specific proposals .	VB `` JJ NN '' IN DT JJ : VB JJ NNS .
They will differ in crucial ways .	PRP MD VB IN JJ NNS .
2 . `` Service '' should be service .	LS . `` NN '' MD VB NN .
As commonly understood , service implies sacrifice .	IN RB VBN , NN VBZ NN .
It involves accepting risk , or giving up income , or deferring a career .	PRP VBZ VBG NN , CC VBG RP NN , CC VBG DT NN .
It follows that proposals like Nunn-McCurdy , whose benefits to enrollees are worth some $ 17,500 a year , do not qualify .	PRP VBZ IN NNS IN NNP , WP$ NNS TO NNS VBP JJ DT $ CD DT NN , VBP RB VB .
There is a rationale for such bills : Federal subsidies to college students amount to `` a GI Bill without the GI '' ; arguably those benefits should be earned , not given .	EX VBZ DT NN IN JJ NNS : NNP NNS TO NN NNS VBP TO `` DT NNP NNP IN DT NNP '' : RB DT NNS MD VB VBN , RB VBN .
But the earnings exceed by 20 % the average income of young high-school graduates with full-time jobs .	CC DT NNS VBP IN CD NN DT JJ NN IN JJ NN NNS IN JJ NNS .
Why call that service ?	WRB VB DT NN .
3 . Encouragement is fine ; compulsion is not .	LS . NN VBZ JJ : NN VBZ RB .
Compelled service is unconstitutional .	VBN NN VBZ JJ .
It is also unwise and unenforceable .	PRP VBZ RB JJ CC JJ .
-LRB- Who will throw several hundred thousand refusers in jail each year ? -RRB-	-LRB- WP MD VB JJ CD CD NNS IN NN DT NN . -RRB-
But through tax policy and in other ways the federal government encourages many kinds of behavior .	CC IN NN NN CC IN JJ NNS DT JJ NN VBZ JJ NNS IN NN .
It should also encourage service -- preferably by all classes and all ages .	PRP MD RB VB NN : RB IN DT NNS CC DT NNS .
Its encouragement should strengthen and not undercut the strong tradition of volunteering in the U.S. , should build on the service programs already in existence , and should honor local convictions about which tasks most need doing .	PRP$ NN MD VB CC RB VB DT JJ NN IN NN IN DT NNP , MD VB IN DT NN NNS RB IN NN , CC MD VB JJ NNS IN WDT NNS RBS VBP VBG .
4 . Good programs are not cheap .	LS . JJ NNS VBP RB JJ .
Enthusiasts assume that national service would get important work done cheaply : forest fires fought , housing rehabilitated , students tutored , day-care centers staffed .	NNS VBP IN JJ NN MD VB JJ NN VBN RB : NN NNS VBN , NN VBN , NNS VBN , NN NNS VBN .
There is important work to be done , and existing service and conservation corps have shown that even youths who start with few skills can do much of it well -- but not cheaply .	EX VBZ JJ NN TO VB VBN , CC VBG NN CC NN NN VBP VBN IN JJ NNS WP VBP IN JJ NNS MD VB RB IN PRP RB : CC RB RB .
Good service programs require recruitment , screening , training and supervision -- all of high quality .	JJ NN NNS VBP NN , NN , NN CC NN : DT IN JJ NN .
They involve stipends to participants .	PRP VBP NNS TO NNS .
Full-time residential programs also require housing and full-time supervision ; they are particularly expensive -- more per participant than a year at Stanford or Yale .	JJ JJ NNS RB VB NN CC JJ NN : PRP VBP RB JJ : JJR IN NN IN DT NN IN NNP CC NNP .
Non-residential programs are cheaper , but good ones still come to some $ 10,000 a year .	JJ NNS VBP JJR , CC JJ NNS RB VB TO DT $ CD DT NN .
Are they worth that ?	VBP PRP JJ DT .
Evaluations suggest that good ones are -- especially so if the effects on participants are counted .	NNS VBP IN JJ NNS VBP : RB IN IN DT NNS IN NNS VBP VBN .
But the calculations are challengeable .	CC DT NNS VBP JJ .
5 . Underclass youth are a special concern .	LS . NNS NN VBP DT JJ NN .
Are such expenditures worthwhile , then ?	VBP JJ NNS JJ , RB .
Yes , if targeted .	UH , IN VBN .
People of all ages and all classes should be encouraged to serve , but there are many ways for middle-class kids , and their elders , to serve at little public cost .	NNS IN DT NNS CC DT NNS MD VB VBN TO VB , CC EX VBP JJ NNS IN JJ NNS , CC PRP$ NNS , TO VB IN JJ JJ NN .
They can volunteer at any of thousands of non-profit institutions , or participate in service programs required by high schools or encouraged by colleges or employers .	PRP MD VB IN DT IN NNS IN JJ NNS , CC VB IN NN NNS VBN IN JJ NNS CC VBN IN NNS CC NNS .
Underclass youth do n't have those opportunities .	JJ NN VBP RB VB DT NNS .
They are not enrolled in high school or college .	PRP VBP RB VBN IN JJ NN CC NN .
They are unlikely to be employed .	PRP VBP JJ TO VB VBN .

Government officials here and in other countries laid plans through the weekend to head off a Monday market meltdown -- but went out of their way to keep their moves quiet .	NNP NNS RB CC IN JJ NNS VBD NNS IN DT NN TO VB RP DT NNP NN NN : CC VBD IN IN PRP$ NN TO VB PRP$ NNS JJ .
Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan was on the telephones , making it clear to officials in the U.S. and abroad that the Fed was prepared to inject massive amounts of money into the banking system , as it did in October 1987 , if the action were needed to prevent a financial crisis . But the officials feared that any public announcements would only increase market jitters .	CC DT NNS VBD IN DT JJ NNS MD RB VB NN NNS .
In addition , officials at the Fed and in the Bush administration decided that avoiding overt actions and statements over the weekend would give them more strength and flexibility should Friday 's market drop turn into this morning 's rout . Resist the urge to call your broker and sell all your stocks .	VB DT NN TO VB PRP$ NN CC VB PDT PRP$ NNS .
That 's the advice of most investment professionals after Friday 's 190-point drop in the Dow Jones Industrial Average .	DT VBZ DT NN IN JJS NN NNS IN NNP POS JJ NN IN DT NNP NNP NNP NNP .
No one can say for sure what will happen today .	DT NN MD VB IN JJ WP MD VB NN .
And investment pros are divided on whether stocks will perform well or badly in the next six months .	CC NN NNS VBP VBN IN IN NNS MD VB RB CC RB IN DT JJ CD NNS .
But they 're nearly unanimous on one point : Do n't sell into a panic .	CC PRP VBP RB JJ IN CD NN : VB RB VB IN DT NN .
Investors who sold everything after the crash of 1987 lived to regret it .	NNS WP VBD NN IN DT NN IN CD VBD TO VB PRP .
Even after Friday 's plunge , the Dow Jones Industrial Average was 48 % above where it landed on Oct. 19 two years ago .	RB IN NNP POS NN , DT NNP NNP NNP NNP VBD CD NN IN WRB PRP VBD IN NNP CD CD NNS IN .
Panic selling also was unwise during other big declines in the past .	NN NN RB VBD JJ IN JJ JJ NNS IN DT NN .
The crash of 1929 was followed by a substantial recovery before the great Depression and awful bear market of the 1930s began .	DT NN IN CD VBD VBN IN DT JJ NN IN DT JJ NN CC JJ NN NN IN DT CD VBD .
The `` October massacres '' of 1978 and 1979 were scary , but did n't lead to severe or sustained downturns .	DT `` NNP NNS '' IN CD CC CD VBD JJ , CC VBD RB VB TO JJ CC VBN NNS .
Indeed , some pros see Friday 's plunge , plus any further damage that might occur early this week , as a chance for bargain hunting .	RB , DT NNS VBP NNP POS NN , CC DT JJ NN WDT MD VB RB DT NN , IN DT NN IN NN NN .

One strategy for investors who want to stay in but hedge their bets is to buy `` put '' options , either on the individual stocks they own or on a broad market index .	CD NN IN NNS WP VBP TO VB IN CC VB PRP$ NNS VBZ TO VB `` VBN '' NNS , CC IN DT JJ NNS PRP VBP CC IN DT JJ NN NN .
A put option gives its holder the right -LRB- but not the obligation -RRB- to sell a stock -LRB- or stock index -RRB- for a specified price -LRB- the strike price -RRB- until the option expires .	DT VBN NN VBZ PRP$ NN DT RB -LRB- CC RB DT NN -RRB- TO VB DT NN -LRB- CC NN NN -RRB- IN DT VBN NN -LRB- DT NN NN -RRB- IN DT NN VBZ .
Whether this insurance is worthwhile depends on the cost of an option .	IN DT NN VBZ JJ VBZ IN DT NN IN DT NN .
The cost , or premium , tends to get fat in times of crisis .	DT NN , CC NN , VBZ TO VB JJ IN NNS IN NN .
Thus , buying puts after a big market slide can be an expensive way to hedge against risk .	RB , VBG NNS IN DT JJ NN NN MD VB DT JJ NN TO VB IN NN .
The prices of puts generally did n't soar Friday .	DT NNS IN NNS RB VBD RB VB NNP .
For example , the premium as a percentage of the stock price for certain puts on Eli Lilly & Co. moved up from 3 % at Thursday 's close to only 3.3 % at Friday 's close , even though the shares dropped more than $ 5.50 .	IN NN , DT NN IN DT NN IN DT NN NN IN JJ NNS IN NNP NNP CC NNP VBD RB IN CD NN IN NNP POS NN TO RB CD NN IN NNP POS NN , RB IN DT NNS VBD JJR IN $ CD .
But put-option prices may zoom when trading resumes today .	CC NN NNS MD VB WRB NN VBZ NN .
It 's hard to generalize about a reasonable price for puts .	PRP VBZ JJ TO VB IN DT JJ NN IN NNS .
But investors should keep in mind , before paying too much , that the average annual return for stock holdings , long-term , is 9 % to 10 % a year ; a return of 15 % is considered praiseworthy .	CC NNS MD VB IN NN , IN VBG RB JJ , IN DT JJ JJ NN IN NN NNS , JJ , VBZ CD NN TO CD NN DT NN : DT NN IN CD NN VBZ VBN JJ .
Paying , say , 10 % for insurance against losses takes a deep bite out of the return .	VBG , VB , CD NN IN NN IN NNS VBZ DT JJ NN IN IN DT NN .

Coldwell Banker Commercial Group said it sold $ 47 million of common stock to its employees at $ 10 a share , giving them a total stake of more than 40 % in the commercial real estate brokerage firm .	NNP NNP NNP NNP VBD PRP VBD $ CD CD IN JJ NN TO PRP$ NNS IN $ CD DT NN , VBG PRP DT JJ NN IN RBR IN CD NN IN DT JJ JJ NN NN NN .

He noted that unlike an employee stock ownership plan , where a company usually borrows money from third party lenders to buy stock that it sets aside to award employees over time , here employees had to fork out their own cash for the stock . He said the offering was designed to create long-term incentives for employees .	PRP VBD DT NN VBD VBN TO VB JJ NNS IN NNS .
`` We 're in a service business , and in that context , it 's vital to have your employees involved in the ownership so they have a stake in the success . ''	`` PRP VBP IN DT NN NN , CC IN DT NN , PRP VBZ JJ TO VB PRP$ NNS VBN IN DT NN IN PRP VBP DT NN IN DT NN . ''
The brokerage firm wo n't pay a dividend on the stock .	DT NN NN MD RB VB DT NN IN DT NN .
Employees have the right to trade stock among themselves , and the company will establish an internal clearing house for these transactions .	NNS VBP DT NN TO VB NN IN PRP , CC DT NN MD VB DT JJ NN NN IN DT NNS .
They may also eventually sell the shares to third parties , but the outside investors who own the remaining 60 % of Coldwell Banker have the right to first refusal .	PRP MD RB RB VB DT NNS TO JJ NNS , CC DT JJ NNS WP VBP DT VBG CD NN IN NNP NNP VBP DT NN TO JJ NN .

The first major event this morning in U.S. stock and futures trading may be a pause at the Chicago Mercantile Exchange .	DT JJ JJ NN DT NN IN NNP NN CC NNS NN MD VB DT NN IN DT NNP NNP NNP .
Under a reform arising from the 1987 crash , trading in the Merc 's stock-index futures will break for 10 minutes if the contract opens and stays five points from Friday 's close , a move equal to 40 points on the Dow Jones Industrial Average .	IN DT NN VBG IN DT CD NN , VBG IN DT NNP POS NN NNS MD VB IN CD NNS IN DT NN VBZ CC VBZ CD NNS IN NNP POS NN , DT NN JJ TO CD NNS IN DT NNP NNP NNP NNP .
The aim of the interruption would be to ease the opening of the New York Stock Exchange , which would be hammered by such a volatile move on the Merc .	DT NN IN DT NN MD VB TO VB DT NN IN DT NNP NNP NNP NNP , WDT MD VB VBN IN PDT DT JJ NN IN DT NNP .
That early-morning breather is just one of a number of safeguards adopted after the 1987 crash .	DT NN NN VBZ RB CD IN DT NN IN NNS VBN IN DT CD NN .
The Big Board also added computer capacity to handle huge surges in trading volume .	DT NNP NNP RB VBD NN NN TO VB JJ NNS IN NN NN .
Several of those post-crash changes kicked in during Friday 's one-hour collapse and worked as expected , even though they did n't prevent a stunning plunge .	JJ IN DT JJ NNS VBD RP IN NNP POS JJ NN CC VBD IN VBN , RB IN PRP VBD RB VB DT JJ NN .
But the major `` circuit breakers '' have yet to be evaluated .	CC DT JJ `` NN NNS '' VBP RB TO VB VBN .
A deeper market plunge today could give them their first test .	DT JJR NN NN NN MD VB PRP PRP$ JJ NN .
A further slide also would resurrect debate over a host of other , more sweeping changes proposed -- but not implemented -- after the last crash .	DT JJ NN RB MD VB NN IN DT NN IN JJ , JJR VBG NNS VBN : CC RB VBN : IN DT JJ NN .
Most notably , several of the regulatory steps recommended by the Brady Task Force , which analyzed the 1987 crash , would be revived -- especially because that group 's chairman is now the Treasury secretary . The most controversial of the Brady recommendations involved establishing a single overarching regulator to handle crucial cross-market questions , such as setting consistent margin requirements for the stock and futures markets . Those pauses -- from 2:07 p.m. to 2:30 p.m. CDT and from 2:45 p.m. until the close of trading a half-hour later -- forced traders to buy and sell contracts at prices at or higher than their frozen levels . During the first halt , after the S&P index had fallen 12 points , the Big Board 's `` Sidecar '' computer program automatically was triggered .	IN DT JJ NN , IN DT NNP NN VBD VBN CD NNS , DT NNP NNP POS `` NN '' NN NN RB VBD VBN .
That system is designed to separate computer-generated program trades from all other trades to help exchange officials resolve order imbalances in individual stocks .	DT NN VBZ VBN TO VB JJ NN NNS IN DT JJ NNS TO VB NN NNS VB NN NNS IN JJ NNS .
